before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"5vprk","text":"All sample processing is to be carried out within a Class II microbiological safety cabinet. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":52,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"88t74","text":"For all centrifugation steps, samples must be placed in centrifuge buckets or directly into a rotor and sealed prior to removal from the cabinet. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4lsc6","text":"All spin steps to be carried out at 4 ºC unless otherwise stated.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"nq2d","text":"Samples should be processed as soon as possible after collection but if this is not possible may be stored at 4˚C for up to 72 hrs. Upon receipt, samples are aliquoted (2x 50ml) and stored at -80˚C, to protect nucleic acid integrity, until ready for analysis.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":64},{"style":"bold","offset":93,"length":37},{"style":"bold","offset":158,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"655g7","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73iqd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b5jsi","text":"As part of the global response to the 2019 novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) pandemic, it was determined that SARS-CoV-2 RNA was detectable in the faeces of both symptomatic and asymptomatic patients (1). ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4ft","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csov3","text":"Further analysis demonstrated that a wastewater epidemiological (WWE) approach, similar to that used to track other viruses (i.e. Poliovirus), could be employed to monitor the spread of SARS-CoV-2. The presence of, or changes in concentration of viral RNA within the wastewater network can assist in monitoring the emergence of further viral peaks (2). Thus, monitoring the spread of Covid-19 using the WWE approach has been extensively explored in several countries (3). ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fgbgu","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"drdv1","text":"This procedure, developed by the Scottish Environment Protection Agency (SEPA) based upon work of the Corbishley group at the Roslin Institute, University of Edinburgh, outlines the method for the concentration of viral RNA in wastewater, as well as in other types of environmental and potable water samples.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"drsh6","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fc24v","text":"In this method, a known volume of sample is concentrated using a centrifugal filter to allow further extraction and detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tko9","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dki9","text":"For further analysis using RT-qPCR please search for \"RT-qPCR for detection of SARS-CoV-2 in wastewater\" by the same authors of this protocol on protocols.io ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ecd8f","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8kj4o","text":"References:","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7d0pl","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4d1lf","text":"1. Jones, D. L., Baluja, M. Q., Graham, D. W., Corbishley, A., McDonald, J. E., Malham, S. K., Hillary, L. S., Connor, T. R., Gaze , W. H., Moura , I. B., Wilcox, M. H., \u0026 Farkas , K. (2020).Shedding of SARS-CoV-2 in feces and urine and its potential role in person-to-person transmission and the environment-based spread of COVID-19.Science of the Total Environment.https://doi.org/10.1016/j.scitotenv.2020.1413644.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":334,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agg35","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6a739","text":"2. Fitzgerald, S., Rossi, G., Low, A., McAteer, S., O’Keefe, B., Findlay, D., Cameron, G. J., Pollard, P., Singleton, P. T. R., Ponton, G., Singer, A. C., Farkas, K., Jones, D., Graham, D. W., Quintela-Baluja, M., Tait-Burkard, C., Gally, D., Kao, R., \u0026 Corbishley, A.(2021).Site specific relationships between COVID-19 cases and SARS-CoV-2 viral load in wastewater treatment plant influent. Environmental Science and Technology. https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.est.1c05029","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":392,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f78fg","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ee4t0","text":"3. Wastewater SARS Public Health Environmental Response (W-SPHERE). https://sphere.waterpathogens.org/about","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":68,"length":39}],"data":{}},{"key":"f8tb5","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c46tr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"310B3703746B11ECBCC40A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://sphere.waterpathogens.org/about"}}}}

funders.funder_name: CREW (Scotland’s Centre of Expertise for Waters)

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"7jhmn","text":"PERFORMANCE AND LIMITATIONS","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fooj7","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsul2","text":"RNA is highly susceptible to degradation by both temperature and enzymes known as RNases. Care must be taken to ensure that all reagents, equipment and working environment are free of RNase contamination and unless otherwise stated, all RNA work should be conducted “on ice” (RNase activity restricted at 4C).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9e1v6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebt6n","text":"False negative result may occur if insufficient target is present due to improper sample transport or storage conditions.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2gfv5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bj8f7","text":"During this process substances which can inhibit enzyme activity and therefore interfere with the qPCR process can also be concentrated. Inhibition is monitored by the inclusion of an internal control added. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hq9q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7dq1g","text":"ANALYTICAL QUALITY CONTROL","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2koe","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ac2vq","text":"Control: Samples are spiked with PRRS1* virus particles as a processing control","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":79}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5e68c","text":"        Samples are spiked with a known quantity of non-target RNA (PRRS1) at the start of the process to demonstrate that the method has been successful at concentrating and recovering RNA particles. Successful recovery of this marker provides reassurance that any negative results are due to the absence of our target of interest in the sample and not because of any methodological failures. ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tc8h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46o7u","text":"*Porcine Reproductive and Respiratory Syndrome (PRRS) – An RNA virus in pigs that can used as a sample process control when testing samples for the presence of SARS-CoV-2 RNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dtqtc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"culei","text":"An extraction Blank shall be included as part of each analytical run.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":2,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9r07g","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56hel","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Wastewater-based epidemiology, Infectious diseases, Public health, RNA extraction, RNA viruses, Covid-19, SARS-CoV-2
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"8eekr","text":"In addition to the facilities and equipment found in a general microbiology laboratory, the following are required:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9o1d7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"981fs","text":"Microbiological Safety Cabinet Class II for sample processing","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"duv9b","text":"Gravimetrically calibrated air displacement pipettors (50 µl to 1000 ml)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1dssr","text":"Sterile, RNase-free, filtered pipette tips","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7kr3o","text":"Amicon Centrifugal Filter Unit (15 ml; 10kDa) (Millipore)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ct434","text":"        NB Amicon centrifuge filters can accommodate 15ml (at a time) with a max speed of 4000 x g if using a swing bucket rotor or 12ml and 5000 x g if rotor is fixed.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":162}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7mrn4","text":"Centrifuge with 50ml tube compatible rotor and aerosol containment buckets","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7rnlh","text":"Balance (0.001g)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ei1a3","text":"Sample Process Control – Inactivated PRRS virus","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5a0i8","text":"QiAmp Viral RNA extraction kit (Qiagen)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8ef3","text":"Micro-centrifuge","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3i8bs","text":"Ethanol (96-100%)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cp8da","text":"0.2 and 2 ml low retention micro-centrifuge tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ho4h","text":"RNase-free 15ml centrifuge tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dp4fu","text":"Cold blocks for 200 µl PCR tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9slkm","text":"Ice maker and flaker","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d53m1","text":"\n\n","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.section: Sample preparation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"n0rt","text":"Remove solid matter from wastewater samples by centrifugation at  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":65,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8ba7e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"4669","duration":600,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"AA12ED5040B811ECBD8AD1506FB69EF4","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

steps.section: RNA Concentration
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3jbaa","text":"Concentrate samples ~ by centrifugation ( ) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":41,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"1500","duration":600,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"DE6D2DE040B811ECBD8AD1506FB69EF4","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

steps.section: RNA Concentration
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d3lj3","text":"Check the level of the concentrate in the filter device by transferring the concentrate to a pre-weighed tube and re-weighing the tube to determine the concentrate volume","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"541q5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: RNA Concentration
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9d7lr","text":"If \u003c250 uL proceed to RNA extraction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dof80","text":"If \u003e250 uL and \u003c 1ml give tubes a further 10 minutes at 4000 x g.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27ccr","text":"If \u003e1ml give tubes a further 15minutes at 4000 x g.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: RNA Concentration
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"61u3","text":"Extract viral RNA using   according to next steps guidelines. Final elution in 60 µl AE buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":24,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":85,"length":9}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"E61424D040B911ECBD8AD1506FB69EF4","id":184384,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"QA_Viral_RNA_Mini.pdf","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fwcabn7x7.pdf"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"FF35B50040B911ECBD8AD1506FB69EF4","url":"https://www.qiagen.com/cn/resources/faq?id=c484a4ad-6f46-4cb5-96f3-875b72f41512\u0026lang=en"}}}}

steps.section: Sample preparation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5hsml","text":"Add a known quantity of Sample Process Control RNA (PRRS) to each sample (view guidelines for more information). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Sample preparation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"duhai","text":"Carefully transfer the supernatant to a clean tube taking care not to disturb the pellet. Discard pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: RNA Concentration
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"42djc","text":"Transfer 15ml of the clarified supernatant from the previous step to a 15 ml Amicon/Centricon Filter (10kDa) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ea8ts","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Viral RNA Purification (Spin Protocol- QIAamp Viral RNA Mini Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6c9ni","text":"RNA is now ready for RT-qPCR. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c97kk","text":"NB Performing a single-spin elution should generate ~50µl of RNA in suspension whereas 2 spins should produce ~70 µl and may increase RNA yield by up to 10%. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9m50o","text":"Record final elution volume.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Viral RNA Purification (Spin Protocol- QIAamp Viral RNA Mini Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6veje","text":"Carrier RNA preparation:","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7tcpt","text":"Add 310 µl Buffer AVE to carrier RNA to obtain 1 µg/µl solution. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67a6l","text":"Divide into 100 µl, single-use aliquots and store at -20°C. Do not freeze/thaw more than 3 times.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36diq","text":"5.6 µl of carrier RNA-AVE is required per sample. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9u16a","text":"For one sample, add 5.6 µl of carrier RNA-AVE to 0.56 ml of AVL buffer. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amp4t","text":"For more than one sample, calculate the volume of Buffer AVL–carrier RNA mix needed per batch of samples (check Table 1 of QIAamp® Viral RNA Mini Handbook)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Viral RNA Purification (Spin Protocol- QIAamp Viral RNA Mini Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9pvsl","text":"Resuspend buffer AW1 in ethanol (96-100%) – 130ml for 250 prep kit, 25ml for 50 prep kit.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Viral RNA Purification (Spin Protocol- QIAamp Viral RNA Mini Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2ugdu","text":"Resuspend buffer AW2 in ethanol (96-100%) – 160ml for 250 prep kit, 30ml for 50 prep kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Viral RNA Purification (Spin Protocol- QIAamp Viral RNA Mini Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bq971","text":"Before starting, ensure that buffer AVE and samples are equilibrated to ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":71,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d2dfe","text":"*Add an extraction blank as part of each analytical run.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":55}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"309t","text":"*An optional positive control containing know quantities of SARS-CoV-2 and PRRS RNA can be included to determine extraction efficiency.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"F2FDA3A0511311EC9C8FA5714F28A62E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}

steps.section: Determination of yield
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"28e4f","text":"\"Yields of viral RNA isolated from biological samples are normally less than 1 µg and therefore  difficult to determine photometrically. Keep in mind that the carrier RNA (5.6 µg per 140 µl  sample) will account for most of the RNA present. Quantitative RT-PCR is recommended for  determination of viral RNA yield\" (from QIAamp® Viral RNA Mini Handbook)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Determination of yield
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b12n1","text":"Proceed with RT-qPCR for detection of SARS-CoV-2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4a6ab","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aunnl","text":"For further analysis using RT-qPCR please search for \"RT-qPCR for detection of SARS-CoV-2 in wastewater\" by the same authors of this protocol on protocols.io ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: RNA extraction from wastewater for detection of SARS-CoV-2

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"brdld","text":"HEALTH AND SAFETY","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qsnn","text":"It is not yet known whether samples which are positive for the presence of SARS-CoV-2 RNA are still viable and therefore present an infection risk. As such the precautionary principle should be applied with all analysis being conducted in a BSL level 2 laboratory. Aerosol-generating procedures should be carried out in a Microbiological Safety Cabinet (MSC). Nitrile gloves must be worn at all times when carrying out this method.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":265,"length":166}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
